definition: to substitute for sb/to remove and replace
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Instead, they watch pirated DVDs or surf the Web.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之，他們看盜版光碟或者在網上衝浪。

sentences.english: I thought it was my brother. But instead, it was two police officers.
sentences.chinese: 我原以爲會是我的哥哥，但取而代之地卻是兩個警察。

sentences.english: Replace sb. , sometimes you can use the four Zhang Tonghua filling.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之，有時你可以用這四張同花加註。

sentences.english: Since September a new book hewing closer to the old style has replaced it.
sentences.chinese: 九月，它就被一本遵守舊樣式的教材取而代之了。

sentences.english: Instead they use materials with lattice structures for both positive and negative electrodes.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之的是在正極和負極上使用柵格結構材料。

sentences.english: The pick withdraws, replaced by Andy's peering eye.
sentences.chinese: 石錘收回，取而代之的是安迪隱現的目光。

sentences.english: Instead, some means of triggering or simulating failures is required.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之的是，需要應用一些觸發和模擬失效的手段。

sentences.english: Instead, he asked the best blacksmiths of the Duchy to fashion him a new sword.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之，他命其領內最優秀的鐵匠鑄造一把新劍。

sentences.english: Blackboards surrender to the Black Forest.
sentences.chinese: 黑板不見了，取而代之的是蔥鬱的黑森林。

sentences.english: Unlimited multi-tasking without nasty looks from the instructor.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之的是無限多任務的平臺任君馳騁。

sentences.english: In its place is the sticky, gooey, sugar-laden, American treat.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之的是糯米，粘性，甜甜的美國美食。

sentences.english: The old cinema was torn down and replaced by a restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 老電影院被拆毀，取而代之的是一個飯店。

sentences.english: Instead, the rocket uses a pneumatic separation system, which can be tested on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之的是氣動分離系統，它的測試可在地面進行。

sentences.english: And fewer teens are wearing watches now because they use their phones to tell time instead (somewhere Chester Gould is wondering how he got it backwards).
sentences.chinese: 如今很少有年輕人佩帶手錶，他們用手機取而代之。

sentences.english: Eventually, when intelligence came on the scene, Lamarckian cultural evolution took over.
sentences.chinese: 最終，智力萌芽，拉馬克的文明進化取而代之。

sentences.english: The party leader has been supplanted by his rival.
sentences.chinese: 那位黨的領導人已被其對手取而代之。

definition: to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
to take off (one's clothes)/(fig.) to shed (one's former image etc)/(of a fad or the after-effects of a disaster etc) to subside/also pr. [tun4 qu4]
to appear/to come out in the open
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
